column1: Steps_Step_Description
Heat oil in a pot or dutch oven over medium heat
Add onions and cook until softened
Add spices and cook for 1 minute
Add tomatoes (diced or canned) and cook for 5 minutes
Add coconut milk, chickpeas, and broth (optional)
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until thickened
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve over rice and garnish with cilantro (optional)
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Toss asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper
Spread asparagus on the baking sheet
Place salmon fillets on top of the asparagus
In a small bowl, combine melted butter, lemon juice, garlic, and herbs
Pour the lemon garlic sauce over the salmon
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil
Cook penne according to package instructions
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook until fragrant
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper
Simmer for 10 minutes
Drain pasta, reserving some pasta water
Toss pasta with the tomato sauce, adding reserved pasta water for desired consistency
Garnish with fresh parsley (optional)
Marinate chicken in fajita seasoning for at least 30 minutes
Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat
Add sliced peppers and onions, cook until softened
Remove peppers and onions from the pan
Cook chicken strips in the pan until browned
Warm tortillas in a skillet or microwave
Serve chicken fajitas with peppers, onions, tortillas, and your favorite toppings (salsa, guacamole, sour cream)
Cut beef into thin strips
Marinate beef in soy sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil (optional)
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat
Stir-fry beef until browned
Remove beef from the pan and set aside
Add broccoli florets to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes
In a bowl, combine soy sauce, cornstarch, water, and sugar (optional)
Pour the sauce into the pan with the broccoli and bring to a simmer
Return beef to the pan and cook until heated through
Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute
Add chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned) and cook for 5 minutes
Add cannellini beans (drained and rinsed), vegetable broth, and dried herbs (thyme, rosemary)
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley (optional)
In a bowl, whisk together Greek yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, oregano, and paprika
Add chicken pieces and toss to coat
Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight
Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat
Thread chicken pieces onto skewers
Grill souvlaki for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through
Serve with pita bread, tzatziki sauce, and salad (optional)
Soak rice noodles in warm water for 15 minutes
Whisk together eggs, fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar in a bowl
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat
Scramble the eggs in the pan, then set aside
Add tofu (cubed and pan-fried) or chicken (cooked and shredded) to the pan
Stir-fry vegetables (bean sprouts, chopped peanuts, scallions) for a few minutes
Pour the egg mixture back into the pan and toss to combine
Drain the rice noodles and add them to the pan
Add tamarind paste (or lime juice) and stir-fry until noodles are heated through
Garnish with chopped cilantro and a squeeze of lime (optional)
Slice eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers
In a bowl, toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper
Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet
Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until tender
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and saute chopped onions and garlic
Add chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned) and simmer for 10 minutes
Layer the roasted vegetables in a baking dish with the tomato sauce
Bake for an additional 10 minutes
Garnish with fresh herbs (basil, thyme) (optional)
Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, and spices (garam masala, turmeric, cumin) for at least 30 minutes
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat
Add chopped onions and cook until softened
Add spices (cumin, coriander) and cook for 1 minute
Pour in coconut milk and chicken broth
Bring to a simmer and add the marinated chicken
Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through
Serve over rice and garnish with fresh cilantro (optional)
Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese
Arrange tomatoes and mozzarella on a plate in an alternating pattern
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar
Garnish with fresh basil leaves (optional)
Marinate beef in a mixture of soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and pepper (optional)
Heat butter in a large pan over medium heat
Saute sliced onions and mushrooms until softened
Remove vegetables from the pan and set aside
Add the beef strips to the pan and cook until browned
Return the vegetables to the pan
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute
Gradually whisk in beef broth and bring to a simmer
Add Dijon mustard, tomato paste, and sour cream
Simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until thickened
Serve over cooked egg noodles
Marinate chicken pieces in soy sauce, cornstarch, and Shaoxing wine (or sherry) for at least 30 minutes
Stir-fry peanuts for a few minutes, then remove and set aside
Stir-fry dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns until fragrant
Remove chilies and peppercorns with a slotted spoon
Add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until browned
Add chopped vegetables (bell peppers, scallions, celery)
Stir-fry for a few minutes
Pour in the prepared sauce (soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, cornstarch mixture)
Stir-fry until the sauce thickens
Return the peanuts to the pan and toss to combine
Serve over rice
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper
In a small bowl, combine melted butter, lemon juice, chopped dill, and garlic (optional)
Place salmon fillets in a baking dish
Pour the lemon dill sauce over the salmon
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through
Serve with roasted vegetables or rice (optional)
Whisk eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat
Pour in the egg mixture and reduce heat to medium-low
Gently fold the eggs with a spatula until cooked through, but still moist
Remove from heat and serve immediately
Cook pasta according to package directions
While pasta cooks, prepare the vegetables (e.g., chop broccoli, carrots, etc.)
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Sauté vegetables until tender-crisp
Toss cooked pasta, vegetables, and your favorite sauce (e.g., pesto, marinara) in a large bowl
Add a splash of reserved pasta water to create a desired consistency
Serve immediately
Butterfly a beef tenderloin by carefully slicing it horizontally, leaving one side attached
Season the tenderloin with salt and pepper
Spread a layer of Dijon mustard over the tenderloin
Layer prosciutto slices over the mustard-coated tenderloin
Spread a layer of duxelles (a mushroom paste) over the prosciutto
Roll up the tenderloin tightly, securing it with butcher's twine
Sear the Wellington in a hot skillet on all sides until browned
Transfer the Wellington to a baking sheet and brush with beaten egg
Bake in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) until cooked through to desired doneness
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving
Mix flaked tuna with mayonnaise, chopped celery, onion (optional), and seasonings (e.g., salt, pepper, lemon juice)
Spread the tuna salad mixture on one slice of bread
Top with lettuce, tomato, and other desired toppings (optional)
Add the other slice of bread and enjoy
Cook diced chicken breasts or thighs in a pot until cooked through
Sauté chopped vegetables (e.g., carrots, peas, onions) in butter or olive oil
Prepare a chicken gravy using broth, flour, and seasonings
Combine cooked chicken, vegetables, and gravy in a baking dish
Line a pie dish with puff pastry or pie crust
Pour the chicken mixture into the lined pie dish
Top with another layer of puff pastry or pie crust, crimping the edges to seal
Brush the top crust with milk or egg wash for browning
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly
Let cool slightly before serving
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions
In a large bowl, combine cooked rice, sushi vinegar, sugar, and salt
Spread the seasoned rice in a baking dish lined with parchment paper
Top with your favorite sushi fillings (sliced vegetables, cooked seafood, cooked chicken)
Whisk together eggs with a splash of soy sauce
Pour the egg mixture over the sushi fillings
Bake in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until the egg is set
Slice and serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi (optional)
Layer Greek yogurt, granola, and berries in a glass or parfait dish
Repeat layers until the glass is full
Drizzle with honey or maple syrup (optional)
Garnish with fresh mint leaves (optional)
Sauté chopped onions and peppers until softened
Season with spices (cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper) to taste
Make indentations in the tomato sauce with a spoon
Crack eggs into the indentations
Cover the pan and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until egg whites are set and yolks are cooked to desired doneness
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and crumbled feta cheese (optional)
Serve with pita bread
Cook fettuccine or other pasta according to package instructions
While the pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large pan over medium heat
Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute
Gradually whisk in milk or cream and bring to a simmer
Simmer for 5 minutes, or until sauce thickens
Season with Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper to taste
Add cooked chicken pieces (grilled, shredded, or leftover) to the sauce
Toss drained pasta with the Alfredo sauce
Serve with additional Parmesan cheese and chopped fresh parsley (optional)
Season ground beef or other protein (chicken, lentils) with taco seasoning
Brown the protein in a skillet over medium heat
Warm corn tortillas in a skillet or microwave
Fill tortillas with your favorite toppings (protein, lettuce, cheese, salsa, sour cream, guacamole)
Fold the tortillas and enjoy!
Heat butter or olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
Sauté chopped shallots or onions until softened
Add chopped mushrooms and cook until browned
Add arborio rice and toast for a minute, stirring constantly
Pour in white wine (optional) and let it simmer until evaporated
Gradually add warm broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the rice to absorb the liquid before adding more
Continue adding broth until the rice is cooked through and creamy, about 20-25 minutes
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and butter (optional)
Garnish with fresh herbs (e.g., parsley, thyme) and serve immediately
Mash a ripe avocado with a fork
Season the mashed avocado with salt, pepper, and lemon juice (optional)
Spread the avocado mixture on toasted bread
Top with your favorite toppings (e.g., sliced tomatoes, red onion, crumbled feta cheese, a fried egg)
Drizzle with olive oil and hot sauce (optional)
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
Prepare your favorite marinara sauce or use a store-bought option
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions
In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce
Layer cooked lasagna noodles over the sauce
Top with ricotta cheese and grated mozzarella cheese
Repeat layers of sauce, noodles, ricotta, and mozzarella until the dish is filled
Top with an additional layer of marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly
Cook short-grain rice according to package directions
Prepare various toppings (e.g., thinly sliced marinated beef, stir-fried vegetables like spinach, carrots, bean sprouts, sunny-side up egg)
Heat a pan and cook the chosen protein (e.g., beef) according to preference
In a heated bowl, arrange cooked rice
Top the rice with your prepared vegetables and protein
Place the sunny-side up egg in the center
Season with gochujang (Korean chili paste), soy sauce, and sesame oil
Mix everything together in the bowl before enjoying
Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Add whole chicken breasts or thighs (bone-in or boneless) and cook until cooked through
Alternatively, use pre-cooked chicken and shred it
Remove chicken from the pot and let it cool slightly
Reduce heat to medium and add chopped vegetables (e.g., carrots, celery, onions) to the broth
Simmer the vegetables until tender-crisp
Add dried egg noodles or other desired pasta (e.g., small pasta shapes)
Season the soup with salt, pepper, and other desired herbs (e.g., parsley, thyme)
Shred the cooked chicken and add it back to the soup
Simmer for a few minutes to heat through
Serve hot
Spread hummus evenly on a whole wheat tortilla
Add your favorite chopped vegetables (cucumber, tomato, bell peppers, lettuce, spinach)
Optional additions: sliced avocado, crumbled feta cheese, sprouts
Roll up the tortilla tightly
Cut the wrap in half (optional)
Cut beef into bite-sized pieces
Brown the beef in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat
Remove beef from the pot and set aside
Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery to the pot and saute until softened
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook for 1 minute
Pour in red wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot
Add beef broth, tomato paste, and herbs (thyme, bay leaf) to the pot
Return the browned beef to the pot
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until beef is tender
Serve over mashed potatoes, egg noodles, or rice
Prepare your favorite fish for tacos (grilled, fried, or baked)
Prepare your favorite taco toppings (shredded cabbage, salsa, crema, avocado)
Place fish on tortillas and top with desired toppings
Serve with lime wedges
Mash black beans in a bowl
Mix in breadcrumbs, an egg, chopped onion, and spices (cumin, chili powder)
Form the mixture into patties
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat
Cook the black bean burgers for 3-4 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through
Serve on hamburger buns with your favorite toppings (lettuce, tomato, cheese, sauce)
Rinse lentils in a colander
Add lentils, vegetable broth, and chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned)
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until lentils are tender
Optional additions: chopped fresh herbs (parsley, thyme), lemon juice
Serve hot with crusty bread
Grill or cook boneless, skinless chicken breasts to your liking
Alternatively, use rotisserie chicken and shred it
Wash and chop romaine lettuce
Croutons can be made by cubing bread, tossing with olive oil and seasonings, and baking until golden brown (optional)
For the dressing, whisk together lemon juice, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, anchovies (optional), Parmesan cheese, and olive oil
In a large bowl, combine romaine lettuce, shredded chicken, croutons (if using), and Caesar dressing
Toss to coat and season with salt and pepper to taste
Garnish with grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately
Whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract (optional), cinnamon, and a pinch of salt in a shallow dish
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat
Dip bread slices into the egg mixture, ensuring even coating
Fry the bread slices in the skillet until golden brown on both sides
Serve immediately with your favorite toppings (e.g., maple syrup, fresh fruit, whipped cream)
Brown ground lamb or beef in a large skillet
Add chopped onions and garlic, and cook until softened
Stir in tomato puree, red wine (optional), and seasonings (e.g., oregano, thyme, cinnamon)
Simmer the meat sauce until thickened
In a separate pan, fry thinly sliced eggplant until golden brown
Prepare a béchamel sauce by melting butter, whisking in flour, and gradually adding milk while stirring constantly until thickened
In a baking dish, layer the fried eggplant slices
Top with the meat sauce
Pour the béchamel sauce over the top, spreading evenly
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly
Heat olive oil in a large paella pan or skillet over medium heat
Sauté chopped chicken, chorizo, and shrimp (or other seafood) until browned
Add chopped onions, garlic, and bell peppers, and cook until softened
Stir in bomba rice (or short-grain rice) and toast for a minute
Pour in hot chicken broth or seafood stock, saffron threads, and chopped tomatoes
Season with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed
Scatter green peas and sliced lemon over the top (optional)
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving
Prepare falafel according to your preferred recipe or purchase pre-made falafel balls
Warm pita bread in a skillet or oven
In each pita bread, place a few falafel balls
Add chopped vegetables (e.jména hummus, tahini, chopped tomatoes, onions, cucumbers) and desired sauces (e.g., tahini sauce, hot sauce) according to your preference
Wrap the pita bread to enclose the filling and enjoy
Cut ripe avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl
Mash the avocado with a fork or potato masher to your desired consistency (chunky or smooth)
Add chopped onion, cilantro, and jalapeño pepper (optional)
Squeeze in fresh lime juice to taste
Serve immediately with chips or vegetables for dipping
Whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and black pepper in a bowl
Cook spaghetti according to package directions
Reserve some pasta water before draining
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a skillet and cook chopped pancetta or bacon until crispy
Remove the pancetta/bacon from the skillet, leaving the rendered fat
Whisk a small amount of the reserved pasta water into the egg mixture
Drain the cooked spaghetti and immediately toss it with the hot pancetta/bacon fat
Pour the egg mixture over the hot pasta, tossing constantly to coat and emulsify the sauce (the heat from the pasta will cook the eggs)
Gradually add more reserved pasta water as needed to create a desired sauce consistency
Toss in the cooked pancetta/bacon and grated Parmesan cheese
Serve immediately with additional Parmesan cheese and black pepper for garnish (optional)
Wash and chop your favorite fruits (e.g., strawberries, bananas, apples, grapes, melons)
Combine the chopped fruits in a large bowl
For a dressing (optional), whisk together lemon juice, honey, and mint (or other desired herbs)
Pour the dressing over the fruit salad (optional)
Toss to coat and serve immediately
In a bowl, toss sliced apples with lemon juice, sugar, and cinnamon
For the crumble topping, mix together flour, rolled oats, cold butter (cubed), and brown sugar using your fingertips until crumbly
Transfer the apples to a baking dish
Sprinkle the crumble topping evenly over the apples
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the topping is golden brown
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream (optional)
Pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts thin and even
Dredge the chicken in flour, then beaten egg, and finally panko breadcrumbs for a crispy coating
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat
Fry the breaded chicken until golden brown and cooked through
Alternatively, bake the breaded chicken on a wire rack over a baking sheet at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes
Prepare your favorite curry sauce or use store-bought options
Serve the cooked chicken katsu over cooked rice and top with curry sauce
Garnish with shredded cabbage and sesame seeds (optional)
Prepare the stock: Add reserved shrimp shells and heads to water in a pot. Simmer for 20 minutes. Strain and discard shells
In a large pot, combine lemongrass, lime leaves, galangal, chilies, fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and chile paste (optional)
Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes
Add shrimp and simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until pink and cooked through
Add mushrooms and simmer for a few minutes
Serve hot, garnished with green onions (optional)
Cook ground lamb or beef in a large skillet over medium heat until browned
Drain any excess fat
Add chopped onions and carrots to the skillet and cook until softened
Stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and seasonings (thyme, rosemary)
Pour in beef broth or red wine (optional) and bring to a simmer
Transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish
Mash cooked potatoes with butter and milk until smooth
Spread the mashed potatoes over the meat mixture, creating a peak in the center
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown
Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just combined (lumpy batter is okay)
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or skillet over medium heat
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through
Serve with butter, maple syrup, or your favorite toppings
Cut kimchi into bite-sized pieces
Heat oil in a pot over medium heat
Saute chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant
Add the kimchi, tofu (cubed and pan-fried), and pork belly (sliced)
Pour in fish sauce, soy sauce, and Korean chili flakes (gochugaru)
Add water or vegetable broth to cover the ingredients
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until softened
Season with sugar and sesame oil to taste
Serve hot with rice and a side of kimchi
Marinate chicken pieces in green curry paste, coconut milk, and fish sauce for at least 30 minutes
Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium heat
Saute chopped onions, bell peppers, and kaffir lime leaves (optional)
Pour in the remaining coconut milk from the marinade
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through
Add bamboo shoots, green beans, and Thai basil leaves (optional)
Simmer for a few minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp
Season with fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar (or brown sugar) to taste
Serve with rice
Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, spices (cumin, coriander, paprika) for at least 30 minutes
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers
Cook chicken shawarma on a grill, grill pan, or in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through
Slice chicken shawarma thinly
Serve in pita bread with your favorite toppings (tahini sauce, chopped vegetables, pickled onions)
Add sliced chicken breast, falafel, or roasted vegetables
Optional additions: crumbled feta cheese, chopped olives, fresh herbs
Add chopped onions and leeks, and cook until softened
Add chopped potatoes and garlic, and cook for a few minutes
Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender
Puree the soup with an immersion blender or in batches in a regular blender
Optional additions: cream or milk for a richer texture, chopped fresh herbs (thyme, parsley)
Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, and spices (garam masala, turmeric, coriander) for at least 30 minutes
Heat butter in a pan over medium heat
Cook pasta according to package instructions
While the pasta is cooking, chop cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil
Drain the pasta and toss with olive oil and balsamic vinegar
Add the chopped tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil to the pasta
Serve at room temperature or chilled
Slice zucchini, eggplant, tomatoes, and bell peppers thinly and evenly
Arrange the sliced vegetables in a round or square baking dish in a decorative pattern (overlapping slightly)
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt, pepper, and Provençal herbs (e.g., thyme, rosemary)
Pour in a splash of vegetable broth or white wine (optional)
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes
Uncover the dish and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly browned
Serve hot or at room temperature
Cook diced chicken breasts or thighs in a pot with chicken broth, chopped onions, carrots, and celery until cooked through
Remove chicken from the pot and shred it
Prepare dumplings according to your preferred recipe using biscuit dough or a flour-based dough
Increase heat to medium-high and bring the broth to a boil
Drop dumplings by spoonfuls into the boiling broth
Reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the dumplings are cooked through
Return the shredded chicken to the pot and stir to combine
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C)
Prepare phyllo dough by thawing according to package directions
Make a chopped nut filling using walnuts, pistachios, or a combination
For the syrup, combine water, sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan and simmer until sugar dissolves
Brush a baking dish with melted butter
Layer sheets of phyllo dough in the baking dish, brushing each sheet with butter
Sprinkle some of the nut filling over the phyllo dough layers
Repeat layering phyllo dough and nut filling, ending with a buttered phyllo dough layer on top
Cut the baklava into desired shapes (e.g., diamonds, squares)
Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy
While still hot, pour the prepared syrup over the baklava
Let cool completely before serving
Toast three slices of bread (white, wheat, or preferred type)
Spread mayonnaise on one slice of bread
Layer sliced cooked chicken breast or turkey breast on the mayonnaise-coated bread
Top with lettuce, tomato, and bacon or ham (optional)
Spread mayonnaise on another slice of bread and place it on top of the ingredients
Repeat layering with sliced cheese, lettuce, tomato, and another slice of cooked meat (optional)
Spread mayonnaise on the final slice of bread and place it on top to complete the sandwich
Secure the sandwich with toothpicks (optional)
Cut the sandwich in half diagonally and serve
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat
Sauté chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until softened
Add diced beef (e.g., chuck roast) and cook until browned on all sides
Stir in curry powder, turmeric, chili powder, and other desired spices
Pour in coconut milk or tomato puree and bring to a simmer
Season with salt, sugar, and fish sauce (optional) to taste
Simmer for 30-45 minutes, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
Serve over cooked rice
Cook elbow macaroni according to package instructions
Drain the pasta and set aside
In a saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour. Cook for 1 minute
Gradually whisk in milk and bring to a simmer. Cook until thickened
Season the sauce with salt, pepper, and dried herbs (thyme, paprika)
In a bowl, combine drained canned tuna, peas, and cooked pasta
Pour the sauce over the pasta mixture and stir to combine
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish
Top with grated cheddar cheese or breadcrumbs (optional)
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper
Dredge chicken in flour
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Sear the chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides
Remove chicken from the pan and set aside
Add mushrooms to the pan and saute until softened
Pour in Marsala wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan
Let the Marsala wine reduce by half
Add chicken broth and bring to a simmer
Return the chicken breasts to the pan and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through
Stir in butter and heavy cream to create a smooth sauce
Serve chicken Marsala with the sauce spooned over it, and mashed potatoes or pasta on the side
Prepare wonton wrappers according to package instructions (thaw if frozen)
Prepare your desired fillings (shredded vegetables, cooked chicken/pork, rice noodles)
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of a wonton wrapper
Fold the wrapper over the filling, forming a triangle shape
Moisten the edges of the wrapper with water to seal
Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C)
Carefully fry the spring rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce (sweet and sour sauce, chili sauce)
Hard-boil eggs and let them cool completely
Peel the eggs and chop them into small pieces
In a bowl, mash the eggs with mayonnaise, mustard, and chopped onions (optional)
Spread the egg salad mixture on slices of bread
Top with lettuce, tomato, and other desired toppings (cucumber, sprouts)
Enjoy as an open faced sandwich or cut the bread slices in half for a closed sandwich
Heat coconut milk in a pot over medium heat
Add lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chilies (bruised or sliced)
Simmer for 10 minutes to infuse the flavors
Remove the aromatics (lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves)
Add chicken pieces and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through
Season with fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar (or brown sugar)
Reduce heat to low and stir in beaten eggs. The eggs should poach in the hot soup
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro, lime wedges, and sliced red chilies (optional)
Serve hot with rice or noodles
Butter one side of each bread slice
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat
Place one slice of bread, butter-side down, in the skillet
Top with your favorite cheese (e.g., cheddar, Gruyère, mozzarella)
Place the other slice of bread, butter-side up, on top of the cheese
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cheese is melted
Cook ground beef in a skillet with chopped onions and garlic until browned
Drain any excess grease
Stir in your favorite enchilada sauce or diced tomatoes, chili powder, and cumin
Warm corn tortillas according to package directions (microwave, stovetop, etc.)
Spread a thin layer of enchilada sauce on the bottom of a baking dish
Place a spoonful of the beef mixture in the center of each tortilla
Roll up the tortillas and place them seam-side down in the baking dish
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas
Top with shredded cheese (e.g., cheddar, Monterey Jack)
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through and cheese is melted
Garnish with chopped cilantro or sour cream (optional)
Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels
Season salmon with salt and pepper
Sear the salmon skin-side down for 3-4 minutes, or until crispy
Carefully flip the salmon and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until cooked through (depending on thickness)
While the salmon cooks, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat
Stir in lemon juice, chopped fresh parsley (optional), and a pinch of salt
Plate the cooked salmon and spoon the lemon butter sauce over the top
Prepare wide rice noodles according to package directions
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat
Scramble eggs in the hot oil until just set, then remove from the wok and set aside
Stir-fry sliced chicken or tofu in the wok for a few minutes
Add chopped garlic, chili peppers (optional), and chopped vegetables (e.g., broccoli, carrots, bean sprouts)
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp
Push the ingredients to the side of the wok
Pour a beaten egg into the cleared space and scramble until cooked through
Add the cooked rice noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce (optional), and a pinch of sugar
Toss everything together until well combined and heated through
Stir in the cooked scrambled eggs and serve immediately
Cut boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs into thin strips
Marinate the chicken in soy sauce, cornstarch (for thickening), and a pinch of ginger (optional) for 10 minutes
Stir-fry the chicken until cooked through and golden brown
Add florets of broccoli cut into bite-sized pieces
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until broccoli is tender-crisp
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, cornstarch, and a pinch of sugar to create a sauce
Pour the sauce into the wok and stir-fry until thickened
Serve immediately over cooked rice
Cook chicken breasts or thighs until cooked through. Shred or cube the chicken
Saute chopped onions, carrots, and celery in butter or oil until softened
Add chopped vegetables to a large pot or Dutch oven
Gradually whisk in chicken broth and bring to a simmer
Add frozen peas, corn, or other desired vegetables
Season the gravy with salt, pepper, and dried herbs (thyme, rosemary)
Stir in cooked chicken and heat through
Transfer the chicken pot pie mixture to a baking dish
Thaw puff pastry according to package instructions
Roll out the puff pastry sheet and cut it to fit the top of the baking dish
Place the puff pastry dough on top of the pot pie mixture, crimping the edges to seal
Brush the puff pastry with milk or egg wash (optional)
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the filling is bubbly
Cream together butter and sugars (brown and white) in a bowl until light and fluffy
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined
Stir in chocolate chips
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges
Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely
Chop tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, and feta cheese into bite-sized pieces
Place the chopped vegetables and cheese in a bowl
Add Kalamata olives (optional)
For the dressing: whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and seasonings (salt, pepper)
Dress the salad with the desired amount of dressing
Toss to combine and serve
Heat oil in a pan or pot over medium heat
Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter for a few seconds
Add ginger and garlic paste, and cook for a minute
Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and chili powder
Add chopped potatoes and cauliflower florets
Pour in water or vegetable broth to cover the vegetables
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until potatoes and cauliflower are tender
Season with salt and garam masala (optional)
Serve hot with rice or naan bread
Broth:  Add charred or roasted shallots, lemongrass stalks (bruised), whole cloves, star anise (optional), and a knob of ginger (bruised) to the boiling water
Simmer the broth ingredients for 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to infuse the water
Strain the broth to remove the aromatics
Meat: In a separate pan, saute sliced beef shank and brisket until browned
Add the browned beef to the broth along with sliced pork hocks (optional)
Simmer for another 30 minutes
Noodles: Boil rice noodles according to package instructions
Accompaniments: Prepare thinly sliced onions, bean sprouts, fresh herbs (basil, mint), lime wedges, sliced chilies (optional)
Assemble: Place cooked rice noodles in a bowl
Top with sliced cooked beef, pork (if using), and other desired protein (shrimp, sliced sausage)
Ladle the hot broth over the noodles and meat
Add desired accompaniments and enjoy!
Soak fava beans overnight in plenty of water
Drain and rinse the soaked fava beans
Cook the fava beans in a pot with fresh water, chopped onion, garlic clove (optional), and a bay leaf until tender
Mash the cooked fava beans with a potato masher or fork to your desired consistency (chunky or smooth)
Season the mashed fava beans with olive oil, lemon juice, tahini paste, cumin, and salt to taste
For a richer flavor, mash in a boiled egg (optional)
Serve hot with chopped parsley, chopped tomatoes, chopped red onion, olive oil, and pita bread
Peel green plantains (unripe)
Boil the plantains in salted water until tender
Alternatively, deep fry the plantains until golden brown and tender
Mash the cooked plantains with a mortar and pestle (traditional method) or a potato masher
While mashing, gradually add butter, garlic cloves (optional), and salt to taste
For a richer flavor, add some fried pork rinds (chicharrones) while mashing
Form the mashed plantains into balls or bowls
Serve hot with your desired accompaniments (e.g., fried meat, garlic shrimp, stews)
Boil or bake sausages (bangers) until cooked through
While the sausages cook, peel and chop potatoes
Boil the chopped potatoes in salted water until tender
Drain the potatoes and mash them with butter and milk (or cream) until smooth
Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste
Serve the cooked sausages on a bed of mashed potatoes with gravy (optional)
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Add chopped onions, bell peppers, and celery, and cook until softened
Stir in chopped garlic and cook for an additional minute
Sprinkle with paprika, cayenne pepper, thyme, and black pepper
Cook for a minute, stirring constantly, to release the flavors of the spices
Dredge cubed chicken or shrimp (or a combination) in flour
Add the dredged chicken/shrimp to the pot and cook until browned on all sides
Pour in chicken broth or seafood stock and bring to a simmer
Reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken/shrimp is cooked through
In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water to create a slurry
Gradually whisk the slurry into the pot to thicken the sauce (add more or less depending on desired consistency)
Season the sauce with salt and filé powder (optional) to taste
Serve hot over cooked rice
Add whole bone-in chicken pieces, chopped onion, ginger (optional), and star anise to the boiling water
Reduce heat, skim any foam that rises, and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and broth is flavorful
Remove the chicken from the pot and let it cool slightly
Strain the broth and discard the solids
Shred the cooked chicken meat
Bring the broth back to a simmer
Cook rice noodles according to package directions
In a serving bowl, place cooked rice noodles, shredded chicken, and bean sprouts
Pour the hot broth over the ingredients in the bowl
Garnish with chopped green onions, chopped cilantro, and lime wedges
Serve with side plates of sliced chilies and hoisin sauce (optional) for individual customization
For the dough: Combine flour, salt, and water in a bowl. Knead until smooth and elastic. Let rest for 30 minutes
For the filling (potato and cheese): Cook and mash potatoes. Mix with grated cheese, sauteed onions, and seasonings (salt, pepper)
Optional fillings: sauerkraut, ground meat and vegetables, sweet fillings (fruits, cheese)
Roll out the dough thinly on a floured surface
Use a cookie cutter to cut out circles of dough
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each dough circle
Fold the dough over the filling and crimp the edges with a fork to seal
Cook the pierogi for 3-5 minutes, or until they float to the surface
Serve with melted butter, fried onions, or sour cream
For the dough: Combine flour, salt, and butter. Cut in the butter with a pastry cutter or your fingers until crumbly
Stir in cold water, a little at a time, until a dough forms. Knead briefly until smooth
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes
For the filling (beef): Saute ground beef with onions, peppers, and spices (cumin, paprika)
Optional fillings: shredded chicken, vegetables, cheese
Brush the empanadas with egg wash (optional)
Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat
Brown beef chunks (stewing beef or short ribs)
Stir in paprika, caraway seeds, and other spices (bay leaf, thyme)
Pour in beef broth or red wine (optional)
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until beef is tender
Add chopped potatoes, carrots, and green peppers (optional)
Simmer for another 30 minutes, or until vegetables are tender
Serve over mashed potatoes, rice, or egg noodles
Boil and mash potatoes until smooth
Saute chopped kale or cabbage with butter and onions until softened
Mix the sauteed kale/cabbage into the mashed potatoes
Season with salt, pepper, and butter
Optional additions: chopped chives, grated cheese
Cook rice according to package instructions
Saute thinly sliced beef in a pan with soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic
Prepare other toppings: julienned vegetables (carrots, spinach, cucumber), fried egg, marinated mushrooms (optional)
Top the rice with the sauteed beef and other prepared toppings, placing them in sections around the bowl
Optional: Add a dollop of gochujang (Korean chili paste) for a spicy kick
Serve with a sesame oil drizzle

Prepare the marinade: In a blender or food processor, combine Scotch bonnet pepper (deseeded for less heat), allspice berries, thyme, ginger, brown sugar, soy sauce, lime juice, and olive oil. Blend until smooth

Marinate the chicken: Place bone-in, skin-on chicken pieces (e.g., thighs, drumsticks) in a large bowl. Pour the jerk marinade over the chicken, coating it evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight for deeper flavor
Cook the chicken: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Place the marinated chicken pieces on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear
Optionally, for a smoky flavor, grill the chicken over medium heat for the last few minutes of cooking
Serve: Serve the jerk chicken with your favorite dipping sauces (e.g., BBQ sauce, hot sauce) and sides (e.g., rice and peas, coleslaw)
Add shredded or chopped beets, chopped onion, carrots, and potatoes to the boiling water
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender
While the vegetables simmer, shred or chop cabbage (optional)
After 15-20 minutes, add the cabbage (if using) and chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned) to the pot
Simmer for an additional 5 minutes
Season the soup with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice to taste
Optional: For a richer flavor, add cooked shredded beef or ground beef that has been browned beforehand
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and chopped fresh dill (optional)
Cut goat meat (bone-in or boneless) into bite-sized pieces
Marinate the goat meat in a mixture of yogurt, curry powder, turmeric, ground cumin, chopped onion, garlic cloves (optional), and chopped fresh herbs (e.g., thyme, cilantro) for at least 30 minutes
Sauté chopped onions and peppers (bell pepper, scotch bonnet pepper for heat) until softened
Stir in the marinated goat meat and cook until browned on all sides
Pour in coconut milk or chicken broth and bring to a simmer
Reduce heat and simmer for 1-1.5 hours, or until the goat meat is tender
Season the curry with salt and additional curry powder to taste
Serve hot over cooked rice with chopped green onions for garnish (optional)
"Prepare lumpia wrappers according to package directions (thaw if frozen)"
Prepare the filling:  Sauté ground pork, chopped onions, garlic cloves (optional), and chopped vegetables (e.g., carrots, peas) until cooked through
Season the filling with soy sauce, fish sauce (optional), and chopped green onions
Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of a lumpia wrapper
Fold the wrapper into a tight roll, sealing the edges with a water-flour paste
Deep fry the lumpia rolls in hot oil (350°F/175°C) until golden brown and crispy
Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce (e.g., sweet and sour sauce, vinegar dipping sauce)

Grind dried chilies (soaked 15 min.), lemongrass, galangal (optional), shallot, kaffir lime leaves, shrimp paste, turmeric, coriander root (optional), cumin seeds (optional), and salt into a paste using mortar and pestle or food processor
Whisk eggs with fish sauce (optional) in a bowl
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and cook whisked eggs into an omelet, folding it in half when set
Stir in the curry paste and simmer for a few minutes
Add chicken pieces and simmer for 10-15 minutes
Season with fish sauce, palm sugar (or brown sugar), and lime juice
Add sliced mushrooms and simmer for an additional 5 minutes
Fold the cooked omelet into the curry and heat through for a minute or two
Serve Tom Kha Kai Kai Dao in bowls with garnish (fresh cilantro, kaffir lime leaves, coconut cream) and cooked rice on the side
Marinate beef roast (round or chuck roast) in a mixture of red wine, vinegar, onions, carrots, and spices (bay leaves, peppercorns) for several days (3-5 days) in the refrigerator
Remove the beef from the marinade and brown it in a hot pan
Strain the marinade and add it to a pot along with water or beef broth
Bring the marinade to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for a few hours, or until the beef is tender
Remove the beef from the pot and let it cool slightly
Strain the cooking liquid and thicken it with a roux (butter and flour) if desired
Slice the beef and serve with the sauce, mashed potatoes, and red cabbage (optional)
Thinly slice beef (bulgogi cut or flank steak)
Marinate the beef in a mixture of soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, and other spices (gochujang for spice) for at least 30 minutes
Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat
Grill the marinated beef for a few minutes per side, or until cooked through
Serve bulgogi on lettuce wraps with kimchi, rice, or noodles
Heat vegetable oil in a pot over medium heat
Chop onions, bell peppers, and tomatoes. Add them to the pot and saute until softened
Add tomato paste, spices (thyme, bay leaf, curry powder), and stock (chicken or vegetable)
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes
Rinse long-grain rice and add it to the pot
Pour in enough stock or water to cover the rice by about an inch
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy
Optional additions: cooked chicken, peas, or other vegetables
Separate the cabbage leaves from the head by blanching the cabbage in boiling water
Make the filling: Combine ground meat (beef, lamb, or a mixture), cooked rice, chopped onions, and spices (salt, pepper, paprika)
Place a spoonful of filling on the wide end of a cabbage leaf
Fold the sides of the leaf over the filling, then roll up tightly
Arrange the stuffed cabbage leaves in a large pot, seam side down
Pour in tomato sauce or broth to cover the sarma
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the cabbage leaves are tender and the filling is cooked through
Serve sarma hot with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt (optional)
Optional additions: chopped potatoes, carrots, green peppers, chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned)
Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm milk and let sit for 5-10 minutes
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, and melted butter
Add the yeast mixture and knead into a soft dough
Let the dough rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size
Prepare your desired savory filling (e.g., ground meat, mashed potatoes, cabbage, mushrooms)
Punch down the dough and divide it into equal pieces
Roll each dough piece into a circle and place some filling in the center
Pinch the dough edges to enclose the filling, forming a bun
Optionally, brush the buns with egg wash for a golden brown color
Bake the pirozhki in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown
Season the chicken with salt and pepper
Spread a pat of cold butter with herbs (e.g., parsley, dill) in the center of each chicken breast
Carefully roll up the chicken breasts to enclose the butter
Dip the rolled chicken in flour, then beaten egg, and finally breadcrumbs for a crispy coating
Deep fry the breaded chicken or bake in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through
While the vegetables simmer, shred cabbage (optional)
Sauté chopped onions and peppers (bell pepper, chili pepper for heat) until softened
Add chopped tomatoes (fresh or canned) and your favorite spices (e.g., cumin, paprika, coriander)
Simmer the tomato sauce for 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld
Create wells in the simmering sauce and crack eggs carefully into each well
Cover the skillet and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and yolks are cooked to your preference
Garnish with chopped fresh herbs (e.g., parsley, cilantro) and crumbled feta cheese (optional)
Serve shakshuka hot with crusty bread for dipping
In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, and eggs
Gradually whisk in milk until a smooth batter forms (thin consistency)
Melt butter in a non-stick pan or crepe pan over medium heat
Pour a ladleful of batter into the pan, swirling to coat the bottom
Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the edges begin to brown and the bottom is loose
Use a spatula to carefully flip the crepe and cook for another 30 seconds, or until golden brown
Fill the cooked crepe with your desired sweet fillings (e.g., jam, Nutella, fruit, whipped cream)
Fold or roll the crepe and serve immediately
Brown cubed pork shoulder or stew meat
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until pork is tender
Optional additions: chopped potatoes, tomatoes (fresh or canned), bell peppers
Serve with egg noodles, mashed potatoes, or rice
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Saute chopped onions, peppers, and tomatoes (fresh or canned)
Add paprika, caraway seeds, and other spices (bay leaf, thyme)
Pour in white wine or fish broth
Add large pieces of white fish (cod, halibut)
Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until fish is cooked through
Boil špekáčky (smoked sausages) in water for a few minutes (optional, to split the casings)
Grill the špekáčky for a few minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through
Špekáčky can also be pan-fried or baked
Serve špekáčky on hamburger buns with mustard, ketchup, and sauerkraut (optional)
Make the dough: Combine flour, water, oil, and salt. Knead until smooth and elastic. Let rest for 30 minutes
Prepare the filling: Saute chopped onions, ground meat (beef or lamb), and spices (paprika, cumin)
Optional fillings: spinach and cheese, potato and cheese, just cheese
Brush the dough with melted butter or oil
Sprinkle the filling over the dough
Roll up the dough jelly-roll style
Cut the roll into pieces and place them in a greased baking dish
Brush the burek with beaten egg (optional)
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 40-45 minutes, or until golden brown
Roast red bell peppers in the oven until blackened
Alternatively, grill the peppers over an open flame
Peel the roasted peppers and remove the seeds
Puree the peppers in a food processor with olive oil, garlic (optional), and a squeeze of lemon juice (optional)
Simmer the pepper puree in a pot over low heat for 10-15 minutes, or until thickened
In a medium bowl, combine cottage cheese, sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla extract (optional)
Mash the cottage cheese mixture with a fork or potato masher until mostly smooth (can leave some small curds)
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, salt, and baking powder
Gradually whisk the dry ingredients into the cottage cheese mixture until just combined (batter should be slightly thick)
In a third small bowl, beat the egg white until stiff peaks form
Gently fold the whipped egg white into the batter until incorporated
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan or crepe pan over medium heat
Serve hot with your favorite toppings (e.g., sour cream, jam, fruit, maple syrup)
Cut boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts into bite-sized pieces
Heat vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat
Dredge the chicken pieces in flour and brown them on all sides in the hot oil
Remove the browned chicken from the pot and set aside
Add chopped onions and paprika to the pot, stirring to coat
Cook the onions and paprika for a few minutes, until softened and fragrant
Pour in chicken broth or white wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot
Bring the broth to a simmer and return the chicken pieces to the pot
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through
In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream and egg yolk (optional) to create a thickening agent
Gradually whisk the sour cream mixture into the simmering sauce, stirring constantly
Season the sauce with additional paprika (to taste), salt, and pepper
Serve Chicken Paprikash over cooked egg noodles (optional) or rice
Pat white fish fillets (cod, haddock) dry with paper towels
Season the fish with salt and pepper
Prepare a beer batter (optional) or a simple batter of flour, eggs, milk, and seasonings
Dip the fish fillets in the batter, coating them evenly
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C)
Carefully fry the battered fish for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through
Peel and cut potatoes into thick sticks (chips)
Par-boil the chips in boiling water for a few minutes to soften them slightly
Drain the chips and let them dry completely
Heat the oil in the pot or deep fryer to a higher temperature (375°F/190°C)
Fry the par-boiled chips in batches for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy
Drain the chips on paper towels to remove excess oil
Season the fried fish and chips with salt and malt vinegar (optional) for a classic English touch
Serve hot with tartar sauce (recipe can be found online) for dipping

Prepare Chicken Kiev: Pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts thin and even. Season with salt and pepper. Spread a pat of cold butter with herbs (e.g., parsley, dill) in the center of each chicken breast. Carefully roll up the chicken breasts to enclose the butter. Dip the rolled chicken in flour, then beaten egg, and finally breadcrumbs for a crispy coating
Encase the rolled chicken breasts in puff pastry dough
Seal the puff pastry dough edges and brush with egg wash for a golden brown crust
Bake the Chicken Kiev Pie in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the chicken is cooked through
Let the Chicken Kiev Pie cool slightly before serving. Slice and enjoy!
In a separate bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, chopped onion (optional), egg (optional), salt, and pepper to make meatballs. Mix well and roll into small balls
Brown the meatballs in a skillet with a little oil over medium heat. Once browned on all sides, drain any excess grease
Add the browned meatballs to the pot with the simmering vegetables and broth
Continue simmering the borscht with meatballs for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through and the flavors have melded
For the dough: Combine flour, eggs, and water. Knead until smooth and elastic. Let rest for 30 minutes
For the filling: Saute chopped onions and mushrooms. Mix with mashed potatoes, grated cheese, and seasonings (salt, pepper)
Optional fillings: ground meat, sauerkraut, sweet fillings (fruit, cheese)
Use a cookie cutter or a glass to cut out circles of dough
Cook the kreplach for 3-5 minutes, or until they float to the surface
Serve with chicken soup, sour cream, or fried onions
Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Brown cubed beef, sausage (kielbasa or andouille), and ham
Stir in tomato paste, sauerkraut, and beef broth
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the meat is tender
Optional additions: chopped vegetables (potatoes, carrots, olives)
Simmer for another 15 minutes, or until vegetables are tender
Season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice to taste
Garnish with chopped fresh dill or parsley (optional)
Cut fresh raw fish (such as tuna, salmon, or sea bass) into bite-sized cubes
Marinate the fish in lime juice, chopped onions, chilies, and cilantro for at least 30 minutes, or until the fish is opaque and cooked through by the acid
In a separate bowl, toss together chopped avocado, tomatoes, red onion, and chopped fresh cilantro
Serve the ceviche with the avocado mixture, along with fried plantains or tortilla chips (optional)
Marinate chicken pieces (bone-in, skin-on) in red wine, brandy, onions, carrots, and herbs (thyme, bay leaf) for at least 4 hours, or overnight
Remove the chicken from the marinade and brown it in a hot pan
Strain the marinade and pour it into a pot or Dutch oven
Bring the marinade to a boil, then add the browned chicken and any vegetables from the marinade
Bring to a simmer and cook for 1-1.5 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through
Optional additions: pearl onions, mushrooms
Thicken the sauce with a roux (butter and flour) if desired
Serve coq au vin with mashed potatoes, rice, or egg noodles
For the wrappers: Combine flour, water, and a pinch of salt. Knead until smooth and elastic. Let rest for 30 minutes
For the filling: Ground pork, shredded cabbage, minced ginger, garlic, and soy sauce
Optional fillings: shrimp and vegetable, chicken and vegetable
Use a gyoza wrapper cutter or a circle cutter to cut out rounds from the dough
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each dough round
Moisten the edges of the dough with water
Separate egg yolks from egg whites
Beat the egg yolks with sugar until light and fluffy
Whisk in mascarpone cheese until smooth
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form
Gently fold the egg whites into the mascarpone mixture
Dip ladyfingers (sponge cookies) in espresso or coffee
Arrange a layer of ladyfingers in a baking dish
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers
Repeat the layers of ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture, ending with mascarpone
Dust the top with cocoa powder
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight, for best results
Make the dough: Combine flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. Add milk and egg, and knead until smooth and elastic. Let rise for 1-2 hours
Fold in cold butter and perform several rounds of folding and resting the dough
Roll out the dough into a rectangle, then fold it over itself several times (lamination)
Cut the dough into triangles and roll them up crescent-shaped
Let the croissants rise again for 30-60 minutes
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and flaky
Prepare dashi (Japanese fish broth) using kombu (kelp) and katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes)
Alternatively, use store-bought dashi
Bring the dashi to a boil
Reduce heat to low and add miso paste. Stir until miso is dissolved, but do not boil
Optional additions: tofu, wakame seaweed, green onions
Serve hot in bowls
Marinate chicken pieces (bone-in or boneless) in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, and tandoori masala for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight
Preheat tandoor oven or grill to high heat
Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers
Cook the chicken in the tandoor oven or on the grill, turning occasionally, until cooked through
The chicken will develop a reddish color from the tandoori masala
Serve tandoori chicken with naan bread, raita (yogurt sauce with cucumber), and chutney (optional)
Mix ground beef or lamb with finely chopped onions, grated garlic, breadcrumbs, and spices (cayenne pepper, paprika, cumin)
Shape the mixture into small sausages or elongated patties
Grill the ćevapčići for a few minutes per side, or until cooked through
Serve ćevapčići in somun bread (pita bread) with chopped onions, sour cream, and kajmak (cream similar to clotted cream, optional)
Mix ground beef and pork (or just beef) with chopped onions, garlic, paprika, and salt
Optional additions: grated cheese, breadcrumbs, sparkling water (for a lighter texture)
Form the mixture into thick patties larger than a hamburger
Grill the pljeskavica for a few minutes per side, or until cooked through
Serve pljeskavica on lepinja bread (Serbian flatbread) with chopped onions, kajmak (cream similar to clotted cream), ajvar (roasted red pepper spread), and sour cream (optional)
Halve bell peppers and remove seeds and membranes
Prepare the filling: Saute ground meat (beef or lamb) with chopped onions, rice, and spices (paprika, cumin)
Optional fillings: vegetarian with lentils, mushrooms, or bulgur wheat
Stuff the pepper halves with the filling
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish or pot
Pour tomato sauce or broth over the peppers
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 45-50 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is cooked through
Prepare the fillings: One filling can be a mixture of sauteed onions, grated cheese (feta or phyllo cheese), and eggs
Another filling can be chopped spinach sauteed with garlic and ricotta cheese
Optional fillings: minced meat, potatoes
Layer the different fillings on the dough
Coil the roll into a snail shape and place it in a greased baking dish
Brush the top with beaten egg (optional)
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown
Soak dried beans (usually white beans) overnight in water
Drain the beans and rinse them
Boil the beans in water with chopped onions, carrots, and bay leaf
Season with salt and pepper
Optional additions: smoked sausage, diced tomatoes, chopped potatoes
Simmer for several hours, or until the beans are tender
You can mash some of the beans for a thicker stew (optional)
Combine cornmeal, flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowl
Gradually whisk in milk or buttermilk until a batter forms
Stir in crumbled cheese (feta or cheddar)
Pour the batter into the skillet and cook for a few minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through
Saute chopped onions and smoked sausage in a pot
Add sauerkraut, diced tomatoes, and beef broth
Season with salt, pepper, and caraway seeds (optional)
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-45 minutes, or until the flavors have melded
